description: [CAF] Perennial favourites Nigeria take on Tunisia in their opening Group B game at the TotalEnergies Women's Africa Cup of Nations, Morocco 2024, with the clash set for the Larbi Zaouli Stadium in Casablanca on Sunday (kick-off 17:00 local time / 16:00 GMT).
title: Africa: Match Facts - Nigeria Start TotalEnergies CAF Wafcon Campaign Against Tunisia

description: [CAF] Algeria take on Botswana in their opening Group B match at the TotalEnergies Women's Africa Cup of Nations, Morocco 2024. The match is scheduled for Sunday at the Père Jégo Stadium in Casablanca (kick-off 20:00 local time / 19:00 GMT).
title: Africa: Match Facts - Algeria, Botswana Clash in Group B Showdown in Casablanca

description: [CAF] Hosts Morocco kick off their TotalEnergies CAF Women's Africa Cup of Nations (WAFCON) campaign against Zambia at the Olympic Stadium in Rabat on 5 July, with kick-off scheduled for 21:00 local time (20:00 GMT).
title: Africa: Match Facts - Morocco, Zambia Compete in TotalEnergies CAF Wafcon Opener

description: [CAF] Senegal face the Democratic Republic of Congo in their opening Group A fixture at the TotalEnergies CAF Women's Africa Cup of Nations, Morocco 2024. The match will be played in Mohammedia on Saturday (kick-off 15:00 local time / 14:00 GMT).
title: Africa: Match Facts - Senegal, DR Congo Open TotalEnergies CAF Women's Africa Cup of Nations, Morocco 2024

description: [CAF] The Confédération Africaine de Football ("CAF") will re-open the Media Accreditation window for the TotalEnergies CAF African Nations Championship (CHAN) 2024 on Saturday, 05 July.
title: Africa: Media Accreditation Window for TotalEnergies CAF African Nations Championship 2024 to Re-Open On Saturday, 5 July

description: [Namibia Economist] Numbeo, the Crowd sourced online database that provides information on the cost of living and quality of life, has released its updated mid-year cost of living index for Southern Africa. Namibia has been ranked third in the region, behind Botswana and South Africa.
title: Southern Africa: Namibia Ranks 3rd in Southern Africa's Mid-Year Cost of Living Index

description: [Independent (Kampala)] Kinshasa, DRC -- The peace agreement recently signed between the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) and Rwanda "is only a beginning; the real work starts now," DRC Foreign Minister Therese Kayikwamba Wagner said late Thursday at a press conference.
title: Africa: Wagner - DRC-Rwanda Peace Deal 'Only a Beginning'

description: [Vanguard] A new mechanism has been introduced, offering debt-distressed countries a way to coordinate their actions and amplify their voice in the global financial system.
title: Africa: UN Inaugurates New Forum to Help Debtor Countries

description: [ISS] Unilateral deep-sea mining, such as that planned by the Trump administration, could have grave impacts on Africa.
title: Africa: Africa Must Help Steer the World Away From Deep-Sea Mining

description: [African Arguments] The Sudan War series is a joint collaboration between the Center for Economic, Legal, and Social Studies and Documentation - Khartoum (CEDEJ-K), Sudan-Norway Academic Cooperation (SNAC) and African Arguments - Debating Ideas. Through a number of themes that explore the intersections of war, displacement, identities and capital, Sudanese researchers, many of whom are themselves displaced, highlight their own experiences, the unique dynamisms within the larger communities affected by war, and readings of
title: Africa: Navigating an Uncertain Environment - Survival Activities of Displaced Sudanese People in Egypt

description: [Ethiopian Herald] At the invitation of Prime Minister of Egypt Mostafa Kamal Madbouly, Premier of the State Council Li Qiang will pay an official visit to Egypt from July 9 to 10.
title: Africa: The Significance of Expanded Brics in Today's Global Landscape

description: [allAfrica]
title: Africa: All of Africa Today - July 4, 2025

description: [Africa CDC] Addis Ababa -- A new study carried out by the Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (Africa CDC) and the UK Public Health Rapid Support Team (UK-PHRST) confirms the critical role international health teams have played in strengthening outbreak response across the African continent. The study also highlights the need for more strategic and locally tailored support models to ensure long-term sustainability and effectiveness.
title: Africa: Study Validates Impact of International Teams in Africa's Outbreak Response

description: [ENA] Addis Ababa, -- Preparations are underway for the official inauguration of the Grand Ethiopian Renaissance Dam (GERD), the largest hydroelectric power plant in Africa, Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed said.
title: Africa: Ethiopia Preparing to Inaugurate Largest Hydroelectric Power Plant in Africa

description: [Premium Times] He said his focus would include building the capacity of National Human Rights Institutions (NHRIs) to be able to meet the ever-growing challenges of resourcing, governance and operations of NHRIs.
title: Africa: NHRC's Head Elected President of West Africa's Human Rights Institutions Network

description: [Daily News] Zanzibar -- ZANZIBAR President, Hussein Mwinyi has urged African nations to take the lead in shaping the global knowledge economy, as he officially opened the Africa QS Forum on Education here yesterday.
title: Africa: Mwinyi Stresses Africa's Role in Knowledge Economy

description: [FrontPageAfrica] Monrovia -- Liberia has been ranked among the top performers in the African Development Bank's 2024 Electricity Regulatory Index (ERI), highlighting the country's growing impact, sustained reforms, and strong political commitment to advancing the power sector.
title: Africa: Liberia Among Top Performers in AfDB's 2024 Electricity Regulatory Index for Africa

description: [World Bank] Washington -- Communities in Rwanda's Southern Province are set to benefit from restored ecosystems, improved agricultural productivity, and expanded sustainable livelihood opportunities in areas vulnerable to climate-related shocks. Thanks to a newly approved $9 million grant from the Global Environment Facility, Rwanda will receive support for integrated landscape restoration and climate-smart land management across the Nyungwe-Ruhango Corridor.
title: Africa: Rwanda to Restore Ecosystems and Boost Climate Resilience in the Nyungwe-Ruhango Corridor

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- African ministers have pledged to protect millions of donkeys from rampant skin trade, marking a turning point for both the animals and the rural communities that depend on them.
title: Africa: Africa Unites to End Donkey Skin Trade in Abidjan Declaration

description: [UN News] Agricultural land is more than just a resource to produce food - for many older adults around the world, a land deed is the only safety net they have as they enter their old age. As a result, they hold onto it tightly.
title: Africa: Landless and Locked Out - Young Farmers Struggle for a Future

description: [UN News] The landmark Financing for Development conference in Sevilla has concluded with a renewed sense of resolve and a focus on action that can change lives worldwide, according to UN Deputy Secretary-General Amina Mohammed.
title: Africa: With Sustainable Development Under Threat, Sevilla Summit Rekindles Hope and Unity

description: [The Conversation Africa] When people think about family planning in Africa, they often picture women visiting clinics, women making decisions, and women bearing the responsibility. Yet family planning affects both men and women.
title: Africa: Men and Family Planning - Studies From 23 African Countries Reveal Gaps in What We Know

description: [The Conversation Africa] Unlike previous economic downturns, the COVID pandemic created a crisis that disrupted both education and employment, abruptly halting young people's emerging careers and clouding their hopes for the future. It doubly affected those transitioning into adulthood, out of school or university and into work, and it threatened the job security of those embarking on their careers when the pandemic began.
title: Africa: The Pandemic Is Still Disrupting Young People's Careers
